description: Derivative of 17th-century vernacular bam (“to trick, to con”), which is a derivative of bam in noun use (fraudster, cheat). Possibly from French embobiner

entries.meaning: (obsolete, informal) A cheat, hoax, or imposition.

verbs.description: bamboozle (third-person singular simple present bamboozles, present participle bamboozling, simple past and past participle bamboozled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To con, defraud, trick, to make a fool of, to humbug or impose on someone.
(transitive, informal) To confuse, frustrate or perplex.
examples: He's completely bamboozled by the changes in the computer system.
